rest.sentence: Organic-inorganic halide perovskite solar cells  have experienced rapid growth in power conversion efficiencies , however, their commercialization is limited by their inherent poor long-term stability
Mixed halide and chalcogenide is a good pathway to fabricate highly efficient and stable solar cells
Here, we constructed halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure in PSCs by incorporating Bi2S3 quantum dots  into 2,2′,7,7′-tetrakis--9,9′-spirobifluorene

The construction of halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure optimizes the energy level matching between spiro-OMeTAD and perovskite, inhibits the decomposition of α-phase FAPbI3 and the formation of δ-phase FAPbI3, increases the hole mobility of spiro-OMeTAD, reduces the defect density, and passivates the defect states
The solar cells with halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure prepared by 0.5 mg/mL Bi2S3 QDs exhibited the highest PCE of 23.31% at standard air mass 1.5 global with enhanced humidity stability
This work provides a perspective on the introduction of halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure to enhance the stability of PSCs.
Download : Download high-res image Download : Download full-size image

Organic-inorganic halide perovskite solar cells  have attracted much attention due to their rapidly increasing power conversion efficiency  , which can be attributed to their high absorption coefficient, tunable bandgap, long carrier diffusion length, high carrier mobility, and low exciton binding energy ,
Although PSCs show great potential as new photovoltaic materials, their commercialization progress was impeded by the inherent poor long-term stability limits ,
New materials, device structures, interfacial modification engineering, and passivation/additive engineering have been developed to enhance the efficiency and stability of PSCs ,

Comprehensive stability has been significantly improved through much effort of researchers, however, the efficiency and stability of PSCs are still affected by hole transport materials , especially HTMs doped with Li+ salts , .
To improve the efficiency and stability of PSCs from the aspect of HTM, Seok et al
developed an inorganic HTM, CuSCN

PSCs with CuSCN as HTM retained 60% of the initial value after storage at 125 ℃ in the air at an average relative humidity of 40% for 2 h, which was higher than the PSCs with 2,2′,7,7′-tetrakis--9,9′-spirobifluorene
used more water-resistant Li-PFSI instead of lithium bisimide , which not only improved the PCE of PSCs , but also enhanced the environmental and thermal stability of PSCs Wu et al
introduced an amorphous TiO2 coating on spiro-OMeTAD to prevent ion migration in PSCsSeo et al
This coating prevents ion migration of lithium additives and diffusion of metal electrodes into the perovskite layer
This layer increases the device efficiency and improves the operational stability of the PSC
added the +-encapsulated indium-based anionic metal–organic framework  to HTMZhang et al
The organic cation vacancies are passivated by FJU-17, and the positively charged oxidized HTM is stabilized by the anionic framework of FJU-17
With this incorporation, the PCE of PSCs increased from 18.32% to 20.34%, and the cells with FJU-17 maintained 90% of the original PCE after 100 h of storage at ambient conditions
introduced silicon dioxide particles at the perovskite/hole transport layer interfacePei et al

The higher thermal conductivity of silicon dioxide particles enhances the thermal stability of the perovskite material and passivates the perovskite through the coordination between the insufficiently coordinated lead centers and the silicon dioxide
The cells with silicon dioxide particles achieved a PCE of 22.29% and improved long-term stability
They retained 91% of their initial efficiency after thermal aging at 85 °C for 1126 h
Although much research work has been done, it is still important to improve HTM to enhance the efficiency and stability of PSCs.
Metal chalcogenides have been applied in solar cells as light harvester due to their high absorption coefficients, tunable bandgaps, multiple excitation capabilities, and solution processability ,
Metal chalcogenide solar cells exhibit excellent stability, and metal halide  solar cells have high PCEs
Therefore, it is a wise choice to obtain efficient and stable solar cells by mixing chalcogenides and halides

In our previous works, we demonstrated antimony sulfoiodide , antimony selenoiodide , alloyed Sb0.67Bi0.33SI, Pb2SbS2I3, and tin-antimony sulfoiodide  solar cells by combining chalcogenides and halides, acceptable PCE and excellent stability were obtained in these cells ,
However, it is not easy to dissolve and process these materials, because these processes usually require high temperature or/and high pressure
If these materials are reduced in size to nanocrystals /quantum dots , their solubility and processing methods can be easily tuned
Quantum dot-sensitized solar cells  are a popular research area due to their high theoretical conversion efficiency, good long-term stability, and low cost ,
By incorporating QDs into HTMs, high efficiency and stability can be expected because QDs have good stability and good energy level matching.
Here, halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure  in PSCs was constructed by incorporating Bi2S3 quantum dots  into 2,2′,7,7′-tetrakis--9,9′-spirobifluorene
Bi2S3 QDs were synthesized by using the hot-injection method
The effect of HCHS on device performance was investigated

X-ray powder diffractometer , ultraviolet–visible  absorption spectroscopy, field emission scanning electron microscopy , time-resolved photoluminescence spectroscopy , electrochemical impedance spectroscopy , and grazing incidence wide-angle X-ray scattering  instrument were used to investigate properties of samples
Defect states are analyzed by using temperature-dependent current–voltage characteristic measurements
PSCs with HCHS prepared by 0.5 mg/mL Bi2S3 QDs exhibited the highest PCE of 23.31% in reverse scan mode
The introduction of HCHS also enhanced the humidity stability of PSCs.
Preparation of FTO/TiO2-BL/mp-TiO2: a 100-nm-thick TiO2 blocking layer  was deposited by performing spray pyrolysis of a 20 mM titanium diisopropoxide bis  solution on FTO glass substrates at 450 °C
Subsequently, a TiO2 paste comprising TiO2 nanoparticles  was spin-coated onto the substrates to form a 150-nm-thick mp-TiO2 layer
The samples were subsequently annealed at 500 °C for 1 h in the air to crystallize TiO2.
Preparation
As shown in Scheme 1, Bi2S3 QDs were synthesized according to a modified hot-injection method ,
S1a shows the XRD pattern of Bi2S3 QDsFig
The characterizations  of the Bi2S3 QDs were shown in the supporting information of the references ,
Bi2S3 QDs were incorporated into spiro-OMeTAD in the sample of glass/perovskite/spiro-OMeTAD to
In conclusion, halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure in perovskite solar cells was constructed by introducing Bi2S3 quantum dots  into the hole transporting layer
The formation of halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure optimized the energy level matching of spiro-OMeTAD and perovskite
The amount of δ-phase FAPbI3 and PbI2 is reduced, thereby reducing defect density, passivating traps, and reducing the charge recombination
Halide-chalcogenide hetero-structure did not significantly alter the

Asthma is a complex, heterogeneous chronic airway inflammatory disorder, which can be simply categorized into eosinophilic and neutrophilic asthma

Although most patients with eosinophilic asthma can be well managed by glucocorticoid therapy, the patients with neutrophilic asthma have poor responses to corticosteroids, and there are no effective clinical treatments for neutrophilic asthma
Studies have shown that M1 macrophages are associated with the pathophysiology of neutrophilic asthma
We previously developed a novel cargo-free anti-inflammatory nanoparticle , which can promote macrophage polarization from M1 to the M2 phenotype
Herein, we aim to explore the therapeutic activities of P12 in eosinophilic asthma and neutrophilic asthma and the mechanisms of action behind
Using the mouse models of eosinophilic and neutrophilic asthma, we found that the intratracheally administered P12 reduced the airway resistance in both models

However, P12 had higher therapeutic effects in neutrophilic asthma than in eosinophilic asthma, particularly on the pathological score, the serum IgE level, the BAL differential cell count and the proinflammatory cytokine IL-17A and IL-6 levels

Mechanistically, P12 facilitated M2 macrophage polarization by inhibiting transcription factors NF-κB and STAT1 activation and up-regulating STAT3 signaling in vitro; in the asthma models, P12 promoted M2 polarization of both alveolar and interstitial macrophages, and reduced the downstream Th17/Treg ratio in mice with neutrophilic asthma
Finally, P12 showed a good biosafety profile in healthy mice, facilitating the clinical translation of P12
This study provides a new strategy and lung macrophage targeted nanotherapeutics for the treatment of neutrophilic asthma.
Perovskite solar cells  with dopant‐free hole transporting layers  deserved extensive research by merits of their outstanding hydrophobicity and stability
However, the low carrier mobility and poor interfacial hole extraction lead to the inferior power conversion efficiency  than that of conventional Li+ doped Spiro-OMeTAD
Here, a design of triphenylamine groups grafted triphenylene derivative  as dopant-free HTLs has been presented
The larger π-conjugation in T-6TPA give rise to high hole mobility of 2.06 × 10−3 cm2V−1s−1
Moreover, the interfacial hole extraction of T-6TPA was significantly promoted when the molecules were infiltrated into perovskite before HTL deposition
The infiltration method of anti-solvent dripping  strategy increased PCE from 18.5% up to 20.3%, which is superior to another additive doping strategy
The effectiveness of An-strategy can be attributed to the construction of a coherent and homogeneous hole transport channel
The hydrophobicity and high glass transition temperature of T-6TPA also granted excellent moisture and thermal stabilities that the initial PCE could remain 80% for 60 days in air or 600 h at 60 °C
This work highlights the synergistical optimization by design of highly hole-mobile materials as well as the interfacial network construction for charge transport.
Defect-free perovskite materials are necessary for developing efficient solar cells
On FTO-glass substrates , cadmium-doped methylammonium lead bromide  films have been deposited
Doping does not affect the cubic crystal structure of MAPbBr3; however, it has increased the grain size, according to XRD
The band gap is decreased at 3% of Cd doping, due to which the deep-level traps are decreased
Every cell shows good performance, but the cell formed with 3% Cd doping has a high fill factor , open circuit voltage , considerable short-circuit current density , and efficiency
The high open circuit voltages and current density refer to the accumulation of charges at the holes and electrons transport layers being reduced due to Cd doping.
An n-type MoO3 thin film was prepared for the first time with solution processable Mo-peroxo  strategy
An aprotic solvent is chosen as an alternative to conventional protic alcoholic diluents for the Mo-peroxo precursor

The proton-donating nature of protic solvents induces gap states to form hole-selective HxMoO3 films, while the absence of proton donors in aprotic solvents facilitates n-type MoO3 thin films by a solution process

The aprotic diluent-based thin film is identified as a peroxy structure at low temperatures and is successfully converted to n-type MoO3 through the removal of peroxide ligands during thermal annealing
Finally, we implement the n-type MoO3 thin film as an inorganic electron transport bilayer paired with SnO2 for 0.950.05 perovskite solar cells
The n-type MoO3 interlayer increases the conductivity of the combined n-type MoO3/SnO2 electron transport bilayer, which improves the charge carrier extraction and transport properties
The prepared perovskite solar cell exhibits enhanced power conversion efficiency  reaching 23.82 % along with a remarkable open-circuit voltage  of 1.16 V.
Ultraviolet  illumination can induce the generation of defects at the interface of perovskite and commonly used electron transport materials  in perovskite solar cells
This further increase the interfacial charge recombination and accelerate the decomposition of perovskite film, resulting in the attenuation of device efficiency and stability
Here, a cerium oxide  nanoparticle with an average size of 18.66 nm is proposed as a novel mesoporous material to modify the interface of ETM and perovskite
The CeOx mesoporous layer with higher electron mobility and more suitable band energy level facilitates charge transfer from perovskite layer
As expected, the mesoporous CeOx based PSCs exhibits an improved power conversion efficiency up to 23.15%
More importantly, the mesoporous CeOx layer  can realize the effective absorption of UV light, to efficiently improve the UV light stability of PSCs and the overall stability of the devices
The unencapsulated devices with mesoporous CeOx maintained almost 90% of initial efficiency after 850 h under UV illumination
This work provides a new approach to fabricate the efficient and UV stable PSCs by introducing the mesoporous CeOx layer.
Perovskite solar cells  have been shining in the photovoltaic industry, but their fragile stability impedes their commercialization seriously
Here we adopt an ultra-thin film of a functional hydrophobic polymer, polychloro-p-dimethyl benzene , which can largely improve the operational lifetime of PSCs as a surface finish

Chemical vapor deposition  under vacuum is adopted to modify the ultra-thin parylene film, which is thin adequately to afford tunnel contact but is also sufficiently shielding to protect the perovskite layer

Besides, it is demonstrated that the Parylene C film can reduce the perovskite surface defects by interacting with the uncoordinated Pb center and act as an effective hole-hindering barrier in the middle of perovskite and PCBM for decreasing charge recombination
As a result, PSC using a ∼4 nm Parylene C layer exhibits a remarkably increased open-circuit and fill factor and a substantially enhanced efficiency of 21.7 % from pristine 19.4 %
Moreover, the Parylene C-based PSCs have attained long-term thermal and operational stabilities with good reproducibility
Without encapsulation, the degradation was limited to 11 % after 500 h of aging under ambient atmosphere/dark, 85 °C/N2, or constant illumination/ N2 conditions
This work lays a solid foundation for further stability by CVD interface modification.
